current_conditions.description: Light Freezing Drizzle and Snow and Fog/Mist

forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow showers and areas of freezing drizzle. Cloudy. High near 30, with temperatures falling to around 28 in the afternoon. North northeast wind 15 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New snow accumulation of 1 to 3 inches possible. Little or no ice accumulation expected.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Scattered snow showers before 3am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 18, with temperatures rising to around 20 overnight. North northwest wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New snow accumulation of less than half an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over the beach in Evanston, temperatures hover in the low 20s, fostering a brisk, biting chill penetrated by a persistent drizzle mixed with light snow and swirling mist. With the humidity enveloping the area, outdoor conditions feel quite damp and raw, compounded by a fierce north-northeast wind that sends flurries racing across the shoreline. Visibility may be compromised as fog drapes over Lake Michigan, dulling the crisp horizon and lending an icy ambiance to the morning.

Looking ahead, today promises snow showers with periods of freezing drizzle, particularly in the afternoon, as temperatures struggle to reach the upper 20s before dipping again tonight. Snow accumulation will likely range between one to three inches, with a chance a few fleeting gusts might blow snow into drifts along the beach. The waves rolling in are considerably agitated, influenced by those gusty winds, making for a potentially tumultuous scene along the waterfront. Given the chill and dampness, dressing warmly in layers—complete with hats, gloves, and waterproof outerwear—remains essential for anyone venturing outdoors. As winter envelops the Great Lakes region, these temperatures are typical for early January, demanding both caution and care as residents and visitors navigate the conditions. While this day may not be ideal for outdoor activities, those keen on winter sports could find solace in the snow, or perhaps retreat indoors to embrace the warmth of a cozy café—savoring a hot drink while watching the flurries dance beyond the window.
